author: reginawills
title: Build Cardano community in Tanzania
description: Falta de conhecimento do ecossistema Cardano na Tanzânia

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal seems to effectively address the idea and strategy for ADA outreach in Tanzania. It seems logical and also the two individuals listed seem to be knowledgeable in the region and likely have a network of individuals that they can build upon to increase the ADA community in that country.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are experienced in the financial markets of Tanzania and the plan is not overly complicated. Its goals are straight forward and obtainable.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics for this project are set forth appropriately, with numbers of individuals to reach out in given times and a start date that is reasonable upon financing of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated namely that Independent or one time events do not build a continuous relationship between Cardano promoters and the target audience.
 
It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief  
 
This proposal shows clearly how it adds value to the Cardano system as it would create a continuous relationship with local schools via clubs and prize driven hackathons 
  
  Key metrics are clear, reasonable and realistic. THese include  Number of schools, how many students in clubs, how many tech institutions, how many clubs,  
 
 
The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge.

 
Proposal can scale to address future challenges by increasing the numbers of abovementioned key metrics. 


This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by increasing the awareness and skills in schools and tech institutions for Cardano Tech and skills

I have given this proposal a 4 star rating because it has gone into detail and shown a realistic and reasonable understanding of the scope of work as well as a reasonable budget. 


If this does not receive funding for whatever reason, one way proposer can improve it is by continuing to build and send press releases to media of your country or social media relating to your subject. Sometimes that one step might motivate someone to view the link and add credibility for your project and give him a better idea on the project which enables him to vote for the project. 

You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise.

I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading. I have also been an event organizer in various capacities, both through my company and on a voluntary basis for youth groups and churches.  I also have run a web development company from 1997 and have been the author of many ground breaking projects in web and Flash related projects in my country.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has   provided evidence  of herself  and the rest of the team. They have experience in Financial education and Blockchain Technology education 
 
  
Links provided are sufficient.
 
 I have visited these links
 
The proposer is competent to organize and run this event.   
 
 
The proposal  gives  details of other partners from different parts of Africa.  
  
She has provided the team structure of partners  

 
 The budget has  been outlined broadly and broken down into identifiable items. General  costs have been given for the various costs
 
The budget is   reasonable to achieve the set goals.   


The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required. 
 
There is no plan for additional funding  if objectives are not met. 
 
The timetable is realstic to organize the event.

 
The proposal  does  provide  a sensible and conductible plan for implementation. 
 

Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are  well described  

  
The proposal has no technical aspects which have need to be addressed 

 
The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal  
 
 
A piece of advice... You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise. A proposer who has considered this, would be looked on more favorably since it shows that they are prepared for various situations and eventualities


Given experience and plan presented it is possible this proposal will be implemented successfully hence I have given a 4 star rating.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a  roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement  
There are  clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal . Number of schools, how many students in clubs, how many tech institutions, how many clubs,  how many new wallets, how many new developers 
There is a clear understandable description of the targeted problem  

 
  
The proposer has not identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties.
   
Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.
The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal hence i have given a 4 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0:
Community events is a way of spreading the word about the Cardano ecosystem, and getting more people involved.
Hosting those five events in 5 different cities in Tanzanie align totally with this challenge.
The collaboration between the community members, proposers, financial companies and events  company(RFFXTZ Company Limited & CHUOLIFE EVENTS) will create a great dynamic that may allow various stakeholders and partners to be part of the ecosystem. 
The idea of having a database for follow up with participants through information sharing and other resources, will contribute to maintain the momentum and get more people involved, even after the duration of the current cycle of the project.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team of proposers is formed by people from the financial background,  working in forex and running a financial company. Their skills in that field is an asset for the success of such an initiative.
Focus on 5 cities in a country on a 1 year period is reasonable from my opinion and allow to well prepare such event, promote it and increase the chance of high participation.
The timeframe is detailed, and the budget too. What I would like to see would be your input and the one of the community members when hosting these events. This because the main goal of the Cardano ecosystem is also to see the community take the ownership of it (For the community, by the community). But in this proposal, we have two groups: Mentors/facilitators and participants.
Would these facilitators be from the RFFXTZ Company Limited? In the description of the proposal you talked about inclusion. is it including community members into the Cardano ecosystem, or those who are under represented? On this some information/stats about how the blockchain Technology is known in Tanzania would be an open eye for people reading this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There's no mention about how the progress would be audited. And also, the company website is not accessible as I thought it would be one of the platform through which people may follow the progress of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great proposal that directly and effectively addresses the challenge. Considering the World Mobile deal with Zanzibar, Tanzania is an important nation for Cardano to be building a community within.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan seems fairly straightforward but I have two concerns. The first one is how the team will spread themselves out throughout 5 different cities within such a large country. The second concern is that the budget may actually be too small to successfully implement this plan
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal goes into sufficient detail for the amount of information. It presents the budget breakdown properly and explains the details of the project well

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal effectively address the challenge because it gives a clear solution to the defined problem statement. However the what immediately dropped to my attention is the budget info; e.g.. Accommodation for 5 regions for 2 Mentors cost more than all marketing material and venue costs for 5 locations. So definitely costs would have to be shared in a different way. 
On the other hand a potential impact on cardano Ecosystem could be rewarding and future scalability is rather large as well.
To conclude, I have to disagree with this proposal mainly due to lacking cost transparency.
f6_assessments.q1:
For the feasibility I rank this proposal as very likely to be implemented with considerable level of success mainly due to the fact the team is well presented and has relevant experience. However I'd need to see more detailed schedule of what is being scheduled when. Just for an example, we have 2 dates for same thing: "Expected public launch: 1st February 2022" and then at the bottom says:"Expected public launch date 15 February 2022".
More importantly - other missing (or even wrong) information is funds spending to which I do not agree. I believe majority of the funds should be spent for the summit organization and associated costs of the summits (venue, marketing and presentation material), instead of to the private pockets (allowance?) and their hotel accommodation.
Having said the above, I neither agree nor disagree with this.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer team addressed basic KPI & metrics (DEFINITION OF SUCCESS).
However, roadmap and clear schedule is missing. Transparency could be much better due to questionable cost details (allowances =25% of the complete funds, together with organizer's accommodation = 45% of total funds!).
Furthermore, risks and challenges are nowhere mentioned or considered.
Based on the above, I disagree with this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal to a certain degree addresses the problem of onboarding and integrating new members. Though it remains to be seen if Project Catalyst and all it's internal components is also part of the presentation material of the intended seminar for there is no mentioning of. This proposal seeks to host 5 seminars across Tanzania and to also follow-up these seminars with online mentorship sessions for those that seeks to participate deeper into Cardano. There is also a mentioning of creating a database of participants which the proposer will use to retarget those participants with contents and updates on Cardano. This proposal can definitely be scaled to encompass more regions and individuals. Their approach of collaborating with universities will send the right signals to the Cardano ecosystem for at this current moment, education on Cardano is key.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers do provide some links and experiences, where of all the proposers and based on what is stated, one proposer in particular instill confidence that this event will go as planned. Budget wise there are discrepancies that would have been avoided if the budget were more in detail. The discrepancies in focus is in regards the comparison between the rent of venues and accommodation of speakers. The value of these two are almost identical. Though it is not a deal-breaking issue, one does hope the budget is maximized for building the community and not for accommodating individuals. The timeline of 1 (one) year does makes sense for it provides moments to reflect and improve. Despite the discrepancies, this proposal if were to happen can be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a general roadmap but no adjoining action plan. KPI's are also present but it only measures one aspect of this proposal. How to achieve that KPI is not present. One of that KPI is onboarding 2000 new members into Cardano after 1 (one) year. Which is a substantial number that needs steps to achieve, knowing those steps will make auditing easier. The preparation of the event and during the event itself is also a total blank. There is a mentioning that by having 1 (one) event every month will give the proposers ample time to do marketing but there is no marketing plan. With that said this proposal will be difficult to audit and recommend to join the workshops done by Catalyst School or at the very least to look up Catalyst School workshops that are uploaded on to YouTube.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem in the proposal is within this challenge. Their success metrics also fit with the challenge setting. But the team should provide more info about how their event will impact the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is a community activity, and it must be well-prepared because it's complex. But the team only show idea and brief for what they do, it's not enough content for showing their ability to do this event, and there is also no roadmap. Therefore, can't assess the feasibility of this proposal. 
Without a roadmap and detailed implementation plan, I can't assess whether the budget is reasonable or not.
f6_assessments.q2:
For helping Catalyst community audit the proposal, the team should give a detailed roadmap with a timeline that is realistic with the ability of team members. This proposal doesn't have these things, that's the reason why this proposal cannot be audited. 
One more thing that I recommend the team is that they need to provide a detailed explanation about the problem, and a solution that to show how they are well-knowing and addressing the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: The project fully meets the requirements of the challenge. Choosing the physical seminars is a conscious and thoughtful choice that is still very valuable and convinces even more people to participate in the community. It is clear that the community wants to attract strong people with the right expertise and experience. These people will also be actively approached in order to addthese new people to the community.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer clearly has the right experience to organize an event, she also chooses to attract other expertise in order to form a strong team. The budget has been worked out well and a lot has already been calculated multiple aspects. The desired recruitment is quite high, this will require a very intensive process. No risk factors or obstacles are included in the proposal. I also can't find how they will lure people to the seminars.
f6_assessments.q2: It is not clearly defined what the timeline of the events is and when these people will be approached after participating in the event. Success is clearly defined but very ambitious.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal aims to provide Cardano Blockchain Technology Education by running locally community event to attract new members from 5 regions of Tanzania for Cardano ecosystem. I agree the proposal's problem is within the challenge.
In plan, the proposers define success (of the proposal) as the number of onboarding members to Cardano ecosystem. I would recommend the proposers should add more success metric to make the proposal more impactful. For example:
- Number of participants
- Number of feedback from participants
- Number of participants that become active community advisors
- Number of particpants that become proposers
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal provides the team's experience and relevant skills; attached 5 photos and 1 video for the evidence of some public blockchain seminars which they executed in Tanzania. However, those photos could not prove they were about Cardano technology, and the 30 seconds long video seems not to show its content a lot. I recommend the team should provide a full video of the seminar to convince readers better.
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items. However, the plan needs more information to be sensible and conductible, such as: content of events in details (attach documents about Cardano and Project Catalyst,...),  marketing strategy to attract people attend events, activities in events, explaination about resources neccessary to organize events as well as challenge and risks which are relevant to the success of events. (For example: the challenge factor is another lockdown as a result of Covid which will require less gathering and contact. In that case the authors has to consider setting up for the virtual meeting). Moreover, the proposers collaborate with a local Company named  RFFXTZ Company Limited and CHUOLIFE EVENTS to run community events, but I cannot find any links or references of them in the proposal.
Since the idea is good, I believe the author can make it to become a fully sensible proposal in next Fund. Now I rate feasibility with a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: I am not sure about the timetable of the implementation. The team tell they will conduct 1 event on every month until finish 5 events in the plan. So it might be executed in 5 months? But there are 3 milestones in the 'Definition of success' (3 months, 6 months and 12 months), and the team did not mention about how long they will implement this proposal. Besides, the proposal gives 2 different 'Expected public launch date' (1st and 15th February 2022). As the timetable is not clear, I assess the proposal is not auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very brilliant. I appreciate the fact that the problem is clearly identified from the challenge. Also seeing that the proposal seeks to create awareness about cardano to the people of Tanzania will be of benefit to the cardano community.
f6_assessments.q1:
With the feasibility criteria, I think the team is well skilled and experienced considering the fact that they have conducted some blockchain seminars previously. I also appreciate the fact that they have attached a photo of one of their seminars.
Also, the number of team members are stated and also their names and professions. They all per their qualifications are professionals. Their budget is good because they have broken it down into identifiable items. The team's plan also justifies the budget stated to execute the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap and milestones are not clearly seen but I can see that they actually integrated or added it in the proposal. The team has also stated the time horizon for the proposal achievement. Another excellent point about the team's proposal is that, they stated the metrics that define the success of their proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem is not well expressed. If there's a lack of awareness of Cardano in Tanzania, what had caused that problem? The causative agent is important and that would help you describe the antidote in details with specifics. The proposal lacks a vivid description of the problem and why that problem continuous to exist.
f6_assessments.q1: The project can be executed looking at the experience they have had in organizing similar events. This will give the project the advantage to reach out to a number of people.
f6_assessments.q2: The project lacks measurable impact. For example, how many people would be able demonstrating profound understanding of Cardano adoption and investment in Tanzania? The important thing is not just about the huge numbers but what goes on beyond the numbers to enhance Cardano community growth. To reach 2000 people in 5 month or more, what would be the impact in terms of percentage growth from one event to another. The project should have also added how much Cardano would be given out to participants for holding. The auditing would be difficult to track for progress.

f6_assessments.q0: Great idea. I did like your attached photo and the huge number of participants. The proposal should have been detailed on what happens after the event. Awareness creation should not end with hosting the event
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal excludes key outcomes to determine what success would mean to the project. Organising the event is within team's control but getting individuals to participants and the target number that the proposal is focusing on isn't stated. I think this is critical for anyone to do determine successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: This is important to document activities within the proposal to enable verifying and easy tracking.

f6_assessments.q0: A convincing proposal. this really has the potential to build the community. I have a little problem with the exponential onboarding of members from 100 to 500 to 2000 and their respective time allocations. Further explanation on how you will be achieving these milestones will enhance your work.
f6_assessments.q1: Great experience and the great team backed by the evidence of crowd-pulling showing in the pictures submitted.  What will be the content of your education?
f6_assessments.q2: Some element of the budget needs to be broken down to enhance audibility. The plan has not been clarified as to how new members will be onboarded from 100 in three months to 200 in one year.

f6_assessments.q0: Ideally increasing the cardano presence in Tanzania is a great idea especially knowing that Tanzania has a youthful population. Definitely such a task requires more hands, experienced enough for the project. Therefore as far as this proposal seeks to expand the cardano ecosystem, I agree that the project addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The vast experience of the team lead for this Proposal makes its execution easy especially having in mind that other experienced personnel will join when this project is funded. Additionally, the proposal captures the specific audience and the number of audience needed for the project at each stage and also outlines timeline for every event. Aside that a detailed breakdown of budgetary allocation is provided. The detailed plan makes it easy for those in cardano ecosystem to join these events if need be. Therefore, this project is will be executed successfully when provided with the needed funding.
f6_assessments.q2: The timeline provided for each event and the audience target makes it easy to monitor and track the success of this project. I will suggest that the team develop a database to capture its audience details to enable them do constant community engagement.

f6_assessments.q0: Building the Cardano community in Tanzania is a good idea and falls within the challenge objectives and will have a positive impact on the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem. The proposer suggest that new talent can found this way and added to the Cardano system, and I agree. I think a lot of hidden talent can be found in the underdeveloped countries. The Key Metrics provided are on how many new community members will be added to the Cardano ecosystem, so the metric are inline with that of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The Proposer provides links to the team's LinkedIn profiles. They have certain degrees in the financial sector, but I do not see specifics on their knowledge and skill set around Blockchain technology and the Cardano system. They might very well have these skills, but it needs to be clear to assessors and voters that the team will be able to convey the correct information through their seminars. Two team members are mentioned that will be involved. The budget breakdown is sufficient, except for what period is the accommodation as it seems a lot for two people for just five events, should it be just one night. It might make more sense if you had broken this down a bit. The Refreshments also seems a lot. The proposer assumes that almost all attendees will join the Cardano community if I look at the definition of success. I find it unlikely that almost every attendee will join the Catalyst Community.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides milestone of how many new community members they hope to add to the Cardano/Catalyst Ecosystem. But this number almost assumes all participants of each event joins, which is a bit unrealistic I think. There is no idea presented on how the Catalyst community will be able to track the progress of these events. The proposer does have a good idea, but just needs to put a bit more information in the proposal as I have mentioned above.

solution: de talentos da Tanzânia e a crescente inclusão no ecossistema cardano.
experience: Gerente de Operações, Instrutor, Enterprenuer. O anexo mostra alguns dos seminários públicos da cadeia de bloqueio que temos realizado na Tanzânia
